meanings.definition: The conditions under which land or buildings are held or occupied.
meanings.sent1: In some places, the tenures of land are passed down through generations.
meanings.sent2: The tenures of the apartments in the city are usually for one year leases.
meanings.sent3: The strict tenures of the old castle made it challenging for anyone to claim ownership.
meanings.sent4: The tenures of the land were like invisible chains binding the owners to their property.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the tenures of the land is crucial for property owners to avoid legal issues.

meanings.definition: The holding of an office or position.
meanings.sent1: His tenures in various leadership roles have given him valuable experience.
meanings.sent2: The tenures of the company executives are often subject to performance reviews.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tenures as the office mascot brought joy to all the employees.
meanings.sent4: Her tenures as team captain were marked by dedication and hard work.
meanings.sent5: The tenures of the mayor are limited to two consecutive terms in office.
